001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Mediator;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.BatchLossFunction;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.DimensionLossFunction;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.SampleLossFunction;
010import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regularization.ExplicitRegularization;
011
012import java.util.*;
013
014/**
015 * The implementation of the {@link ObjectiveFunction}.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * {@code ObjectiveFunctionImpl} composes together different levels of
019 * loss functions — dimension, sample, and batch — to provide a complete
020 * objective function suitable for training and optimization.
021 * </p>
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * The implementation delegates responsibility as follows:
025 * <ul>
026 *   <li>Uses a {@link DimensionLossFunction} to compute per-dimension error
027 *       and parameterGradients.</li>
028 *   <li>Uses a {@link SampleLossFunction} to aggregate dimension-level losses
029 *       into a single sample loss.</li>
030 *   <li>Uses a {@link BatchLossFunction} to aggregate sample losses into a
031 *       batch loss.</li>
032 * </ul>
033 * </p>
034 */
035@Mediator
036@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
037public class ObjectiveFunctionImpl<N extends Number> implements ObjectiveFunction<N> {
038
039    private final Set<ExplicitRegularization<N>> regularizations = new LinkedHashSet<>();
040
041    private final SampleLossFunction<N> sampleLossFunction;
042    private final List<DimensionLossFunction<N>> dimensionLossFunctions;
043    private final BatchLossFunction<N> batchLossFunction;
044    private final boolean optimize;
045
046    /**
047     * Creates an {@code ObjectiveFunctionImpl} that computes losses at all levels:
048     * dimension, sample, and batch.
049     *
050     * <p>This constructor links together the components needed for hierarchical
051     * loss computation:</p>
052     * <ul>
053     *     <li>{@link BatchLossFunction}: computes the total loss over a batch of samples.</li>
054     *     <li>{@link SampleLossFunction}: computes the loss for a single sample by
055     *         aggregating per-dimension losses.</li>
056     *     <li>{@link DimensionLossFunction}: computes the loss for each individual
057     *         output dimension.</li>
058     * </ul>
059     *
060     * @param batchLossFunction      the loss function for the batch level
061     * @param sampleLossFunction     the loss function for the sample level
062     * @param dimensionLossFunctions the list of loss functions for each output dimension
063     */
064    public ObjectiveFunctionImpl(BatchLossFunction<N> batchLossFunction, SampleLossFunction<N> sampleLossFunction, List<DimensionLossFunction<N>> dimensionLossFunctions, boolean optimize) {
065        this.batchLossFunction = batchLossFunction;
066        this.sampleLossFunction = sampleLossFunction;
067        this.dimensionLossFunctions = dimensionLossFunctions;
068        this.optimize = optimize;
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * {@inheritDoc}
073     */
074    @Override
075    public boolean isOptimization() {
076        return optimize;
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * {@inheritDoc}
081     */
082    @Override
083    public void addRegularization(ExplicitRegularization<N> regularization) {
084        regularizations.add(regularization);
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * {@inheritDoc}
089     */
090    @Override
091    public void removeRegularization(ExplicitRegularization<N> regularization) {
092        regularizations.remove(regularization);
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * {@inheritDoc}
097     */
098    @Override
099    public Set<ExplicitRegularization<N>> getRegularizations() {
100        return Collections.unmodifiableSet(regularizations);
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * {@inheritDoc}
105     */
106    @Override
107    public N calculateLossWithoutRegularizationPenalty(List<Pair<N[], N[]>> batch) {
108        List<N> sampleLosses = new ArrayList<>(batch.size());
109        List<N> dimensionLosses = new ArrayList<>();
110        for (Pair<N[], N[]> sample : batch) {
111            N[] estimated = sample.left();
112            N[] target = sample.right();
113            int dimensions = estimated.length;
114            for (int d = 0; d < dimensions; d++) {
115                dimensionLosses.add(getDimensionLossFunction(d).calculateDimensionLoss(estimated[d], target[d]));
116            }
117            sampleLosses.add(sampleLossFunction.calculateSampleLoss(dimensionLosses));
118            dimensionLosses.clear();
119        }
120        return batchLossFunction.calculateBatchLoss(sampleLosses);
121    }
122
123    @Override
124    public N calculateRegularizationPenalty(N[] parameters) {
125        N totalPenalty = getCurrentNumberType().zero();
126        for (ExplicitRegularization<N> regularization : regularizations) {
127            totalPenalty = getCurrentNumberType().add(totalPenalty, regularization.lossPenalty(parameters));
128        }
129        return totalPenalty;
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * {@inheritDoc}
134     */
135    @Override
136    public N[] calculateGradient_dJ_da(int batchSize, N[] estimated, N[] target) {
137        int dimensions = target.length;
138        JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport = getCurrentNumberType();
139        N[] gradients = typeSupport.createArray(dimensions);
140        for (int d = 0; d < dimensions; d++) {
141            gradients[d] = typeSupport.multiply(typeSupport.multiply(
142                            batchLossFunction.calculateGradient_dJ_dL(batchSize),
143                            sampleLossFunction.calculateGradient_dL_dl(dimensions)),
144                    getDimensionLossFunction(d).calculateGradient_dl_da(estimated[d], target[d]));
145        }
146        return gradients;
147    }
148
149    @Override
150    public N regularizedGradient(N parameter) {
151        N totalAdjustment = getCurrentNumberType().zero();
152        for (ExplicitRegularization<N> regularization : regularizations) {
153            totalAdjustment = getCurrentNumberType().add(totalAdjustment, regularization.gradientAdjustment(parameter));
154        }
155        return totalAdjustment;
156    }
157
158    private DimensionLossFunction<N> getDimensionLossFunction(int d) {
159        return dimensionLossFunctions.get(d % dimensionLossFunctions.size());
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * {@inheritDoc}
164     */
165    @Override
166    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getCurrentNumberType() {
167        return batchLossFunction.getCurrentNumberType();
168    }
169}
